from py4j.java_gateway import java_import

# Import Hadoop FileSystem classes
java_import(spark._jvm, 'org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem')
java_import(spark._jvm, 'org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path')

# Get the Hadoop FileSystem instance
hadoop_conf = spark._jsc.hadoopConfiguration()
fs = spark._jvm.FileSystem.get(hadoop_conf)

# Define the path to the directory
path = "abfss://data@dp203dushyantdatalake.dfs.core.windows.net/sales_data/poscsv/"

# Function to list files and directories
def list_files_and_dirs(directory):
    file_list = []
    try:
        status = fs.listStatus(spark._jvm.Path(directory))
        for file_status in status:
            if file_status.isFile():
                file_list.append(file_status.getPath().toString())
            elif file_status.isDirectory():
                file_list.append(file_status.getPath().toString() + "/")
                file_list.extend(list_files_and_dirs(file_status.getPath().toString()))
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: {e}")
    return file_list

# List files and directories
files_and_dirs = list_files_and_dirs(path)

# Show all paths
for item in files_and_dirs:
    if '.csv' in item:
        print(item)
